param.name: pDecoder
param.para: A pointer to the interface. To get this pointer, call

param.name: pView
param.para: A pointer to a interface. This interface describes the resource that will receive the decoded frame. To get this pointer, call .

param.name: ContentKeySize
param.para: The size of the content key that is specified in pContentKey. If pContentKey is NULL, set ContentKeySize to zero.

param.name: pContentKey
param.para: An optional pointer to a content key that was used to encrypt the frame data. If no content key was used, set this parameter to NULL. If the caller provides a content key, the caller must use the session key to encrypt the content key.

param.name: NumComponentHistograms
param.para: The number of components to record a histograms for. Use to check for support. Use zero when not recording histograms or when the feature is not supported. Specifying fewer components than are in the format implies that those components do not have histogram recording enabled. The maximum number of components is defined as D3D11_4_VIDEO_DECODER_MAX_HISTOGRAM_COMPONENTS.

param.name: pHistogramOffsets
param.para: An array of starting buffer offset locations within the ppHistogramBuffers parallel array. Use to index the array. If a component is not requested, specify an offset of zero. The offsets must be 256-byte aligned.

param.name: ppHistogramBuffers
param.para: An array of target buffers for hardware to write the components histogram. Use to index the array. Set this parameter to nullptr when the component histogram is disabled or unsupported

remarks.para: The following flags are allowed when allocating resources for video decode histograms.
All other D3D11_RESOURCE_MISC flags are disallowed.

summary.para: Provides the video functionality of a Microsoft Direct3D 11 device. This interface provides the method, which provides support for decode histograms.
